intro: Cynoglossum turkestanicum, commonly known as Turkestan bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Cynoglossum turkestanicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
